item.title: My CV
item.description: Paul Behrends My name is Paul, Iâ€™m German and I was born on February 15th, 1997 Linkedin Education 2020-2022 London Business School (Masters in Financial Analysis) 2015-2019 Bocconi University (Bachelor in Economics and Management) Work Experience 2020-2020 (3 months) Rothschild & Co (Intern in Frankfurt Office) 2019-2019 (3 months) DZ Bank (Intern in Frankfurt Office) 2019-2019 (3 months) goetzpartners Consultants (Intern in Munich Office)

item.title: Cities with the highest amounts in political contributions in California during the 2016 US Presidential election
item.description: As discussed in class, I would like you to reproduce the plot that shows the top ten cities in highest amounts raised in political contributions in California during the 2016 US Presidential election. CA_contributors_2016 <- vroom::vroom(here::here("data","CA_contributors_2016.csv")) Zip_codes <- vroom::vroom(here::here("data","zip_code_database.csv")) Zip_codes_clean <- filter(Zip_codes, state == "CA") Cali_contributors <- CA_contributors_2016 %>% filter(cand_nm %in% c("Clinton, Hillary Rodham","Trump, Donald J.")) joint_zip <- merge(Cali_contributors, Zip_codes_clean, "zip") new_data <- joint_zip %>% group_by(cand_nm) %>% count(primary_city, wt = contb_receipt_amt, sort = TRUE) new_data %>% group_by(cand_nm) %>% top_n(10) %>% ungroup %>% mutate(cand_nm = factor(cand_nm), primary_city = reorder_within(primary_city, n, cand_nm)) %>% ggplot(aes(x = primary_city, y = n, fill = cand_nm)) + geom_col(show.

item.title: What is the relationship between COVID deaths and presence of comorbidities and ICU admission in patients
item.description: Homework 2 Challenge 1 Let us revisit the CDC Covid-19 Case Surveillance Data. There are well over 3 million entries of individual, de-identified patient data. Since this is a large file, I suggest you use vroom to load it and you keep cache=TRUE in the chunk options. # file contains 11 variables and 3.66m rows and is well over 380Mb. # It will take time to download # URL link to CDC to download data url <- "https://data.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
